byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Interest in the foreign exchange market last week was at its lowest ebb in months, a reflection of the caution of buyers in the face of the long holiday and the modest amount of balancing called for at the month-end. The net result of this inaction...
docs.lead_paragraph: Interest in the foreign exchange market last week was at its lowest ebb in months, a reflection of the caution of buyers in the face of the long holiday and the modest amount of balancing called for at the month-end. The net result of this inaction left the major currencies at substantially the same price level that ruled in the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 3, 1948

docs.snippet: TRENTON, N.J., Sept. 5 -Bringing to a climax the Lebanese national festival of Al-Mahrajan here today, Dr. Stephen B. L. Penrose, president-designate of the American University in Beirut, hailed the influence of Lebanon as one of the factors in...
docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, N.J., Sept. 5 -Bringing to a climax the Lebanese national festival of Al-Mahrajan here today, Dr. Stephen B. L. Penrose, president-designate of the American University in Beirut, hailed the influence of Lebanon as one of the factors in American greatness.

docs.snippet: Activity on a pre-war scale is expected on New York piers today when more than 6,000 passengers are scheduled to arrive from Europe. South America and the West Indies on nine liners and Army transports.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 7 (AP) -- The value of the Uruguayan peso depreciated today as the Banco de la Republica resumed operations in the "free market" after a one-month suspension.

docs.snippet: The French Cabinet crisis and the extremely serious situation which continues to prevail in Berlin where the Western Powers are locked with Russia over the peaceful occupation of that city, made for a soft undertone in the foreign exchange market...
docs.lead_paragraph: The French Cabinet crisis and the extremely serious situation which continues to prevail in Berlin where the Western Powers are locked with Russia over the peaceful occupation of that city, made for a soft undertone in the foreign exchange market last week.
